meanings.definition: To change or move something slightly to make it more suitable or effective.
meanings.sent1: She had to adjust the chair to reach the table.
meanings.sent2: He adjusted the volume on the TV to hear better.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to adjust the size of the box to fit inside.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic adjusted the engine to run more smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Adjusting the thermostat made the room more comfortable.

meanings.definition: To adapt or become accustomed to new conditions or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: After moving to a new country, she had to adjust to the different culture.
meanings.sent2: It took him some time to adjust to his new job.
meanings.sent3: The penguin had to adjust to the warmer weather in the zoo.
meanings.sent4: She had to adjust to the idea of living alone.
meanings.sent5: Adjusting to the time difference was challenging but necessary.
